intro: Mascagnia australis, commonly known as the Australian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, black seeds. Mascagnia australis is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively drought-tolerant once established.
